pages.text: In general, photonics-based weaponry is composed of four major components:$(li)Casing$(li)Weapon Core$(li)Energy Cell$(li)Modifiers$(br)These components act in concert to produce and focus electromagnetic energy that can then be directed towards a target.

pages.title: Optical Core
pages.text: Most photonics components must be mounted on a chassis designed to reduce optical energy loss. Such a chassis consists of a radiation-shielded lens suspended in a highly-reflective tin frame.

pages.title: Armament Assembler
pages.text: Photonics-based weaponry can be assembled automatically using a CNC-derived system. The system is built on an optical chassis, which prevents energy leakage during the fabrication process.

The $(2)Armament Assembler$() allows for the installation of photonic components into a weapon casing. This is accomplished by placing a weapon casing into the left slot and the desired component in the right. If the installation is permissible, the $(o)Install$() button can then be pressed to complete the process. Note that this is non-reversible: installed components cannot be removed from a casing.
The top row of slots will display the installed components for the casing, if present. These slots cannot be interacted with and are merely for informational purpose.
